title: Cursor focus goes to address bar, instead of search box, when opening a firefox window - started after 105.0 update.
content: See abstract. Updated to Firefox V105.0 today, and now the cursor starts in the address bar, instead of the search box middle of the page. I have tried that "about:config handoff" fix and it doesn't work for me. I think this is about the third or fourth time we have lost the "cursor starts off in the search box" functionality in the last few years, after a Firefox update. Can you code writers leave it in the search box? Please?
creator: MrSensible

title: Actualización 2022/09/21
content: ¿A quien se le ocurrió la brillante idea de hacerle un marco al navegador? Solo estorba e impide el usar correctamente el mismo, de por sí, con el aumento del tamaño la barra de navegación se hizo más molesto y desagradable, ahora el marco del navegador hace que en ves de cambiar de pestaña se de clic en es nuevo marco y es muy molesto. Deberían hace una opción para modificar al menos esos aspectos tan pésimos que se le ocurre al diseñador de imagen. A este paso me regresaré a Chrome que su interfaz es mucho más cómoda y supera por mucho los nuevos cambios que le están metiendo al navegador actual.
creator: apocalipsisrage

title: Browser connection issues
content:
Whenever I load a youtube video, it would not load and when refreshed it would give this connection error. The screenshots posted are the few issues I have, whenever I try googling any items I would have to wait roughly a minute to click a link as it would not even respond. I have deleted my profile, cleared the cache, fully uninstalled the browser, did a virus scan, ran SFC, fully refreshed a DNS, checked the ping and would get a stable connection, and I cleared all of my add-ons and received the same issue. This is not just google and facebook, I would have several issues when browsing. I would be unable to use google docs as it would be disconnected periodically to the point where my work has come to a halt.

Is there anything else that can be done? Attached are the relevant screenshots.

Thank you.
creator: gflute89

title: HI Jacking
content:
Several times I have been attacked while I was on Firefox. 'IT' has closed my browser, closed my work program: Promark Time card & Voxco. I have changed my ATT modem password several times because I thought 'IT' was coming thru the modem. Today I was Time Card when this popped up. I was able to copy the information 'IT' was attempting to send me to. Here it is:

We can’t connect to the server at ee.com. Did you mean to go to www.ee.com/post_sign_in?code=d_6BgaGS8100EQg-&state=TUdJZEpXVW05VX51cWNofjRuc1VuY0lVSVpTY2p2MGFHQmYyeTdXcGczUQ%3D%3D?

If you entered the right address, you can: 

   Try again later    Check your network connection    Check that Firefox has permission to access the web (you might be conn
creator: jackie4961

title: One site suddenly loads only page titles with no text or other content. All other sites work normally.
content:
Until a few days ago, the site dailykos.com worked relatively normally. (By normally, I mean that the body of each article, including links and some of the embedded videos/photos were there and could be read. The comments and some of the pictures have never loaded. I thought it might be due to my privacy settings or extensions, but those weren't that important to me, and I never tried to fix that.) Now the site's pages are blank except for the title (see screenshot). The site loads normally in Safari on my iMac, and in the latest version of Firefox on my wife's MacBook Pro. I've compared the settings between her copy of Firefox and mine, and I can't see any significant differences. (We are both still using MacOS Catalina, but plan to upgrade to Monterey very soon.)

Things I've tried that didn't work include restarting both Firefox and my Mac, clearing my cache (it was zero bytes, but I clicked "Clear" anyway), deleting all cookies, including any for Daily Kos, except for a few cookies I need to keep, disabling all my extensions (see photo) and turning off enhanced tracking protection for the site. After these actions, I restarted Firefox, but the DK pages are still empty. An Internet search found only a few articles about similar but not identical problems from several years ago to January 2022. A search of the Mozilla returned zero results.

I should mention that I -think- this started after one of the last two Firefox updates. I'm using version 105.0. I'm fresh out of ideas, and I'd appreciate any help the community or developers can give me. Thank you very much. - Don
creator: pthg3
